title: Examples do not build under VS2013

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug reports and bugfix pull requests

labels.name: build
labels.description: Build file bugs and PRs (not compilation errors)

body:
Hi,

I've been trying to build GLFW using CMake 3.3.1 under Windows 7 x64 with Visual Studio 2013 and MSBuild.
The build fails multiple times when compiling linmath.h.

My concrete build steps were:
- create new folder "build" in fresh checkout of glfw from git
- cd into that build folder with a "VS2013 x64 Native Tools Command Prompt"
- while having cmake/bin in PATH, invoke: `cmake .. -G "Visual Studio 12 2013 Win64"`
- after that succeeded, invoke: `MSBuild GLFW.sln`

I have worked-around this issue so far with disabling the build of examples via the cmake switch `-DGLFW_BUILD_EXAMPLES=false`.

Here is the build output for the last failing example "wave" (additional failing examples were 'boing', 'particles' and 'splitview'):

```

"D:\downloads\glfw\build\examples\wave.vcxproj" (Standardziel) (49) ->
```

At least the issue with the first error 2054 of an unrecognized `inline` keyword in msvc seems to be this: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24736304/unable-to-use-inline-in-declaration-get-error-c2054
